result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessie A Beverly was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 04-17-2015 @ 1:30pm, Br-40

miscConds.notes: $80.00 payable to Milwaukee Police Dept., to be paid first and foremost. Cash bail on deposit in 14CM3436 to apply.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case,including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the DOC's. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
- No firearms/weapons. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
- Successfully complete "Batterers Intervention" counseling.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended tratment including random urine screens.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Successfull complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to No Violent Contact.
- Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
- Pay all supervision fees as determined by the DOC's.
- Obtain/maintain employment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jessie A Beverly

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jessie A Beverly not in court.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Per email from Probation Dept., defendant is currently in absconder status.  Court ordered defendant to serve 30 days of the condition time; straight time.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.

Defendant Jessie A Beverly in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Defendant Jessie A Beverly in custody.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 3:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  
*
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 29 days time served.  

AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days concurrent in the House of Correction with credit for 29 days time served.  

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 4/17/15.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
-Restitution in the amount of $80.00; payable to the Milwaukee Police Department; to be paid first and foremost.  Cash bail on deposit in 14CM3436 to apply.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell in court, defendant Jessie A Beverly not in court, in custody.  Ryan T. Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Status Conference held.  Court will take defendant's other criminal case for resolution.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Case set for status conference.  Attorney Mitchell could not appear as he had child care issues.  Case adjourned to 1/09/15 at 8:30 am.  rmm

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: PATRICIA F.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jessie A Beverly in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Jessie A Beverly in custody.  Ryan T. Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40 due to lower pending cases ( 14CM3436).  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALITY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Status conference/Bail Bond Hearing scheduled for January 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
